definition: the shaft of a pen or writing brush/pen-holder/pen
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
stick/pole/lever/classifier for long objects such as guns

sentences.english: The pen is mightier than the sword.
The pen is the tongue of the hand.
Selected Works of Mao Tse-tung is the classic translation penned by those translators but who were being guarded by gun.
sentences.chinese: 是手裏拿着筆桿子背後站着槍桿子逼出來的經典翻譯。

sentences.english: I could imagine that my old penholder feels reproachfully towards me .
sentences.chinese: 我能夠想象得到，我的老筆桿對我有責難之意。

sentences.english: In the jacket's back, just below her left shoulder blade, was a round hole that would have admitted the shaft of a pencil.
sentences.chinese: 夾克的背後，左肩下方的位置有一個鉛筆桿粗細的洞。

sentences.english: He lives only by his pen and could do nothing when running into a problem.
sentences.chinese: 他光會耍筆桿，碰到實際問題就束手無策。

sentences.english: Basically, one should use five fingers to hold a Chinese writing brush and keep the shaft upright.
sentences.chinese: 拿中國毛筆的方法一般是五指執筆法，筆桿要豎直。

sentences.english: He finished with the sword to cause, I will use the pen to complete.
sentences.chinese: 他用寶劍未能完成的事業，我將用筆桿來完成。

sentences.english: You mean your penmanship is good? Is thatit?
sentences.chinese: 你是說筆桿子還行，是嗎？

definition: thick and thin/coarse and fine/thickness (caliber)/coarseness/quality of work
